Accelerator Physics and Technology Workshop for Project X
November 12-13, 2007

Introduction
Introduction

▪ Two years ago, a preliminary design study was done for a target for proton driver beam parameters. No further work has been done since then. All numbers, graphs shown are for proton driver parameters ( about 10% different).

Important issues for target design
Important issues for target design

• Dynamic stress from short pulse
• Dynamic stress from short pulse

• Getting the DC heat out
• Getting the DC heat out

• Radiation damage
• Radiation damage

• Efficiency of neutrino production
• Efficiency of neutrino production

Nov. 12, 2007 Project X Workshop – IHEP 2MW Target - Jim Hylen
Nov. 12, 2007 Project X Workshop – IHEP 2MW Target - Jim Hylen

Issues for dynamic stress
Issues for dynamic stress

To reduce dynamic stress, want: •
To reduce dynamic stress, want:
•

Fewer protons/pulse
Fewer protons/pulse

Neutrino production scales approximately with beam power so fewer protons at 120 GeV than eg 30 GeV helps
Neutrino production scales approximately with beam power
so fewer protons at 120 GeV than eg 30 GeV helps

Having more pulses of fewer protons each would help
Having more pulses of fewer protons each would help

Spread protons out in larger beam spot, use low density target
Spread protons out in larger beam spot, use low density target

Horn has ~ 1m long depth of field, few mm wide collection area
Horn has ~ 1m long depth of field, few mm wide collection area

so can use less dense target
so can use less dense target

• High heat capacity, so dE/dx produces less temperature rise
• High heat capacity, so dE/dx produces less temperature rise

• Low coefficient of thermal expansion, so temperature rise produces less expansion
• Low coefficient of thermal expansion, so temperature rise produces less expansion

• Low Youngs Modulus, so thermal expansion produces less stress
• Low Youngs Modulus, so thermal expansion produces less stress

• High yield strength
• High yield strength

Beryllium has high yield strength, but high Youngs Modulus Graphite has mediocre yield strength, but low Youngs Modulus
Beryllium has high yield strength, but high Youngs Modulus
Graphite has mediocre yield strength, but low Youngs Modulus

Nov. 12, 2007 Project X Workshop – IHEP 2MW Target - Jim Hylen
Nov. 12, 2007 Project X Workshop – IHEP 2MW Target - Jim Hylen

NuMI baffle as prototype of target
NuMI baffle as prototype of target

Graphite is good in compression, poor in tension,
Graphite is good in compression, poor in tension,

so put pre-stress at outer radius by encapsulating in aluminum or steel
so put pre-stress at outer radius by encapsulating in aluminum or steel

Existing NuMI baffle is 1.5 m long, 6 cm diameter graphite encapsulated in aluminum
Existing NuMI baffle is 1.5 m long, 6 cm diameter graphite encapsulated in aluminum

Target would be 1 m long, 1.5 cm diameter – not too different from our baffle;
Target would be 1 m long, 1.5 cm diameter – not too different from our baffle;

get rid of air cooling fins, add water cooling tubes
get rid of air cooling fins, add water cooling tubes

Nov. 12, 2007 Project X Workshop – IHEP 2MW Target - Jim Hylen
Nov. 12, 2007 Project X Workshop – IHEP 2MW Target - Jim Hylen

Other target details
Other target details

• Graphite in 3 cm long segments with 0.2mm gaps for thermal expansion • Helium atmosphere in target to prevent possibility of oxidation • Encapsulation also maintains integrity of the target core in case of thermo-
• Graphite in 3 cm long segments with 0.2mm gaps for thermal expansion
• Helium atmosphere in target to prevent possibility of oxidation
• Encapsulation also maintains integrity of the target core in case of thermo-

mechanical or radiation damage of some segments
mechanical or radiation damage of some segments

Encapsulation also prevents direct contact of the cooling water with the heated surface of graphite while providing a good thermal contact Study was done with Poco ZXF-5Q graphite (what we have in the NuMI target),
Encapsulation also prevents direct contact of the cooling water with the heated
surface of graphite while providing a good thermal contact
Study was done with Poco ZXF-5Q graphite (what we have in the NuMI target),

although other graphites have up to 30% better Yield/Youngs-Modulus
although other graphites have up to 30% better Yield/Youngs-Modulus

Pre-stress: ~ 10 MPa if 0.2 mm steel casing, ~13 MPa if 1mm aluminum casing
Pre-stress: ~ 10 MPa if 0.2 mm steel casing, ~13 MPa if 1mm aluminum casing

Beam spot size: 1.5 mm RMS
Beam spot size: 1.5 mm RMS

Energy deposition (kW):
Energy deposition (kW):

Compare stress to failure
Compare stress to failure

Taking into account decrease of yield strength of 0.5 due to fatigue and applying Mohr-Coulomb criteria, the safety factors (failure stress divided by calculated stress) are:
Taking into account decrease of yield strength of 0.5 due to fatigue
and applying Mohr-Coulomb criteria, the safety factors
(failure stress divided by calculated stress) are:

Hence calculation says graphite should not fail.
Hence calculation says graphite should not fail.

(However, even if a segment fails, there is really no place for it to fall apart into?)
(However, even if a segment fails, there is really no place for it to fall apart into?)

Nov. 12, 2007 Project X Workshop – IHEP 2MW Target - Jim Hylen
Nov. 12, 2007 Project X Workshop – IHEP 2MW Target - Jim Hylen

Target cooling design
Target cooling design

Water in the cooling tube would experience 2 ksi hydraulic shock from heating by the beam spill. Two ways have been suggested to reduce this:
Water in the cooling tube would experience 2 ksi hydraulic shock from heating
by the beam spill. Two ways have been suggested to reduce this:

• Two phase flow – e.g. bubble helium through the water similar to
• Two phase flow – e.g. bubble helium through the water similar to

what we did when the 1st NuMI target developed a leak
what we did when the 1st NuMI target developed a leak w h a t

• Use “heat pipe” evaporative cooling
• Use “heat pipe” evaporative cooling

Work is needed to prototype and evaluate these and possibly other schemes
Work is needed to prototype and evaluate these and possibly other schemes

Further work is also needed on window design, although calculations for use of graphite windows is encouraging.
Further work is also needed on window design, although calculations for use of
graphite windows is encouraging.
